name: Newport Belle Bed & Breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a wonderful time in Newport, and a very good expeience on the New port Belle. The hosts, Nancy and Michael could not have been more cordial and welcoming.! We stayed two nights, and thought eveything about the place was wonderful. We especially enjoyed the "Happy Hour" in the living area - a great opportunity to meet people and have some interesting conversation. We would not hesitate to reccommend this B & B!!
reviews.title: Geat stay at the Newport Belle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights on the Oregon coast at the Newport Belle Bed and Breakfast. This riverboat bed and breakfast in the South Beach Marina in Newport, Oregon was absolutely charming. The decor of the main living and dining areas is darling. Our stateroom was quite spacious and had it's own bath. The bed was comfortable and it was very quiet as well. Our host and hostess, Michael Wilkinson and Nancy Sims, couldn't have been nicer or more welcoming. They provided wonderful treats in the late afternoon (homemade cookies, wine, beer, chips and salsa) that hit the spot. They were a great source of information on the local area as well, providing tips on places to eat or visit. It was great conversing with them. They also allowed my husband to commandeer the TV in order to watch the USC football game being broadcast! Both mornings we were treated to a wonderful homemade breakfast. Nancy really went out of her way to accomodate my husband's quirky eating habits which we greatly appreciated. There were a number of other couples staying there as well and it was fun getting to talk with them. All in all, we had a delightful time and we wouldn't hesitate to recommend staying at the Newport Belle to anyone open to a totally different bed and breakfast experience in a lovely setting and hosted by two charming people!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Newport Belle

reviews.text: My wife and I spent one night at the Newport Belle earlier this week. Nancy and Michael are new to the B and B business and absolutely great hosts. We stayed on the third deck in a small but comfy room with a nice view of Newport harbor. The innkeepers have lots of information available for visitors to Newport, a nice sitting area on the second deck that serves as a place to meet in the evening and where breakfast is served. Be sure to visit the aquarium.
reviews.title: Great place to stay!

reviews.text: The Belle is near the Rogue Brewery - a place that anyone interested in micros should visit.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay
Fell in Love with the Ship
reviews.text: It doesn't get better than this. You can't believe the views. We loved the Newport Belle B&B and its owner. We had access to the deck and the living room area. Beds are quite comfy and the sound of the lapping water was a heavenly lullaby. Breakfast was a gourmet feast. Can't wait to go back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Belle was stay number 2 of 10 during our roadtrip through Oregon, we had just left a beach cottage and onto a boat! Walking down the metal ramp in the pouring rain we wondered after the stormy day (which was not bad - glad we experienced a coast storm - awesome wave action) we wondered if we'd be rocking and rolling through the night. Nope. Steady she goes - not a move.
reviews.title: Belle of Newport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by a tiny terrier in a bright yellow raincoat (that lives there and escorted us to our stateroom) so the uniqueness of this stay was evident the whole time! The hosts (and I'm talking the dogs too...) were great. Made us feel right at home, showed us the indoor family room/breakfast room/outdoor lounge area and the stocked fridge with beverages and snacks for the taking. Offered restaurant rec's and sites to see. View of the Yaquina Bridge was great and the town of Newport is right across the way.
reviews.title: Comfy, Quirky, & Fun

reviews.text: We were in Stateroom #1 at the bow and the room was beautiful. Warm pine wood, very large bath (didn't expect that!) with glassed in shower. Table and chairs in the room at the windows and lots of space for storage (like a big open pine closet with bench). The queen bed was very comfy with plenty of blanket/comforters and fuzzy socks (since it is a boat and black shoes marks are a no-no). Room was much more spacious than I imagined it would be since I've slept on plenty of boats in my lifetime - and this was no bunk or V-berth!
reviews.title: Newport Belle - Extraordinary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean, clean, clean - polished woods, felt like you were in your own pine cabin. It was great. No TV in room (good!) but large screen upstairs with a huge DVD/VCR collection if you are the screen staring type. We choose to drink some local brews and set up some cheese and meats from Tillamook we had bought on the way down; we played a few rounds of Scrabble we got from the game chest and made up our own rules on words as we went along and the beer went down (when was the last time we played scabble???) When the storm finally began passing the coast we walked around the wet marina and watched the gulls dive for their dinner. Long day of driving and seeing the coast made for an earlier night - but know there is a large local brewery/restaurant on the other end of the large marina parking lot.
reviews.title: loved the Belle

reviews.text: Breakfast was great - plentiful - help yourself kind as it came out hot. Fruits, yogurt juices, coffee, freshly made eggs and sausage, homefires, breads, bagels, jams - all hot and homemade. Very good.
reviews.title: Very, Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We like staying in quirky places which is why we went with the Newport Belle. I wish I could say that we liked it more, but we just didn't. But first the positives. I had made a mistake in booking and had actually booked the wrong day, but Michael was very gracious in accomodating us on the day we arrived anyway. (In fact, HE was kind and charming throughout our stay.) Other positives = mini-fridge in the lobby with sodas and a basket of chips and the like out at night, also fruit and a carafe with a small amount of sherry, if we were so inclined. Negatives, now. The place just needs updating to start with. We stayed in the largest room, I believe, but it just seemed warn and sad. Plastic flowers everywhere. No real theme to the decor. Pictures on the wall without glass. I hate to say it, but it's just a little on the tacky side, which is not what we look for. The price we paid was comparable to the prices we paid at far, far nicer establishments in places like Portland and Astoria on this same trip. It just wasn't worth it. Also, you have to drive over the bridge to get to the little village of Newport. Not a problem getting there but if you want to go out in the evening -- and really, you do, AND if you'd like to enjoy some of the city's fine brew or some of Oregon's lovely wines, then be prepared to not only D & D, which is not our practice normally, but to D & D over a MONSTER of a bridge. So, here's the deal -- if you are really into the B & B scene and like to linger and chat with folks (one of whom reminded us so much of Harry Schearer doing a bit!), AND if you aren't really into nice ammenities in the bathroom (tiny, but we expected that given that we were staying on, you know, a boat), AND if decor isn't important to you -- say, if you have plastic flowers decorating YOUR house -- then, go for it. The view of the bridge is glorious!
reviews.title: Wish we had liked it more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just wish we could have stayed more than one night. Very friendly innkeepers who truely love what they are doing. They are familar with the immediate area--things to do, places to eat, etc. Their menu book could be better organized. All the comforts of home--staterooms are very spacious. Great breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

reviews.text: As others have said, this is a really unique place to stay. It is an acutal boat with quarters.
reviews.title: Great Attention to Detail!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The one thing we noticed was the attention to detail! Before you even knew you wanted something they were offering it to you!
reviews.title: Love the Belle

likes.liked: — The Paddleboat is a brilliant idea

reviews.text: In your room, you would find candies, bottled water, coffee makers, and the best of all - socks to wear around the room! In addition the robes were the best I have ever had and felt like I was surrounded in a cloud!
reviews.title: What A Fun Place
Unique experience - great location.
reviews.text: The Newport Belle is a riverboat that is docked not too far from the old city of Newport. The owners live on the top floor, while the middle floor is a common area and the lower floor houses guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The boat is in great shape as are the rooms. Of course, this being a boat, the rooms aren't as spacious as some might be accustomed to, but this should detract from the novel experience.
reviews.title: Amaving Time on the Newport Belle

likes.disliked: — Curtains at windows would be more in character than venetian blinds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfasts were delicious and filling (ask for the recipe for the granola - we're still making it regularly at home) and the owners were very pleasant to chat with (They're also quite patient. While we were there, there was a particularly annoying guest aboard, but the hosts managed to deal with them in a pleasant manner - I probably wouldn't have been so kind.)
reviews.title: Great boat, wonderful breakfast, brewery close by

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh, and the boat is docked walking distance from the Rogue brewery, so be sure to stop by for a meal and drink. Very tasty beer.
reviews.title: A Great Stay

likes.disliked: — The marina was commercial rather than boat slips.

reviews.text: I recommend this B & B both for it's uniqueness and quality. It's a welcome respite from the main strip of Newport.
reviews.title: Fantastic boat!

description: The Newport Belle Riverboat B&B is located on the central Oregon coast. Moored in the South Beach Marina with views of the Yaquina Bay, Bridge, & the pleasure craft, it offers 5 guest rooms, all with private bath. Enjoy the spectacular view from the aft deck solarium, or enjoy the charming atmosphere of the main salon. The woodstove takes the chill from the cool sea air and provides a warm and beautiful place to relax.
